rComments: HE IS A HORRIBLE TEACHER. NEVER TAKE A COURSE WITH HIM AS A PROF. Horrible lecture structure, jumps around a lot. Absolutely horrible jokes. Don't ask questions or for help because he wont give strait answers and goes on talking for long amounts of time, straying from said topic very often. In short should not of been given this job.

This was my first history class since I'm not a history majorminor. I took it in the summer at UTM and really enjoyed the content. Loudon spent a lot of time on art (not my thing) and expected a lot of reading. Interesting lectures, for the most part. Assignments were fairly straightforward. Helpful if you ask for it but somewhat condescending.
Average Prof, no glaring deficiencies, nice guy

It was a slap in the face to come back to school in January and have Loudon instead of Bartlett. Loudon is alright, don't get me wrong, but he's not even in Bartlett's league. The biggest problem I had with him: he's not that nice a person outside of lectures. If you approached him to ask questions he made you feel like a complete idiot.
A complete disappointment compared to Bartlett. Complete opposite of Bartlett.

A disappointment. Completely unorganized during lecture, jumped around from topic to topic without making connections or fully explaining something. Bad jokes. He wasn't as bad as some profs, but compared to Bartlett he is definitely mediocre. Needs to improve on organization and explanation.

The class cried in silence as Loudon replaced Bartlet half way through the year. Silence soon turned to open revolt and Loudon was forced to halt lecture numerous times to tell people to "Shut Up". What a debacle!
loudon means well, i think.  hes not a bad guy, but his lectures are NOT interesting, generally.  hes not passionate.  compared to bartlett hes a disapointment.

One of the worst professors I've had! His lectures were difficult to follow and furthermore nothing of what he said was important. I was better off skipping lecture and reading Spielvogel. He was not a very approachable or friendly person.

Very knowledgable but jumps around with the material.  Although, my disenterest is part my fault - his material doesn't interest me as much as Bartlett's (indust. rev. et al = blah!) This may be the root of the critiques. He is a good prof but can't compare to Bartlett. He's just missing that jazz!

Well, he starts his lectures with 15 minutes telling you what he's going to talk about, then he jumps from topic a to topic c to topic b and back again (really tough on notes) and then he says that he's not going to cover it because it's all in the text.  GRRRRRR!!!!

I frankly think that Loudon is doing a great job! He doesn't -read- off of his notes, from what I've seen. And also, he brings to light certain key themes that Bartlett did not mention. If anything, I think this guy is going to help me study for my exam better than Bartlett would have.
He was a better lecturer than Bartlett.

Seems like a nice guy but his lectures were so dry and all over the place..didn't get much out of them, better off just reading Speilvogel.. he didn't really lecture, just read his lecture notes for the most part.. must be tough to follow Bartlett though
Better than Bartlett...

Probably knows his stuff, but I did not benefit much from it. Improved marginally as the year went on, but lectures were very dull and rambling; difficult to discern important points. Pay attention to Spielvogue text for best results.

Definitely knows his stuff but his lectures are absolutely impossible to follow. Bartlett was much more interesting and easier to follow despite the fast pace he set. He just doesn't compare. Better off just reading the textbook than attending lectures.

Loudon is one of the worst profs I've had.  His lectures are boring and almost impossible to follow.  He speaks using language that is inaccessible to the students, and doesn't make key points very clear or obvious.
Sometimes he's a bit boring... but he knows his stuff. On the whole, he's a great prof!
Good prof, solid lecturer, seems like a nice guy.  Just has a near-impossible task following Bartlett.  Students in Bader are merciless with him, I feel bad for him sometimes.
good lecturer (though not as good as Bartlett); clearly outlined themes of the course.   was a bit boring and all over the map at first, but much better by the end of the year

He's a great guy, he's very nice and very approachable, but his lectures are dry as toast.  The poor guy pales in comparison to Bartlett, but he's a tough act to follow.  He tries his best, I'm sure, but he's not very exciting, that's for sure.

His lectures are very, very difficult to follow.  He makes no effort to descend (mercifully) to the level of students to make the material A BIT CLEARER.  Instead, he rambles about a million of things at once, with no connecting links
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Not worthy to stand in the shadow of Bartlett.

His lectures are soooo dry and can drag on with them forever. One of the most important things he is missing, is Bartlett's enthusiasm and love of the subject. Btw, Loudon dresses very fancy - one of the best dressed university professors I've seen.
He's the hottest prof at U of T. A good lecturer too! Young and fresh...just how I like 'em!!!  :)
Very good professor.  I enjoyed his lectures, though they were sometimes dry (but I blame the material, not the presentation.)  Better than Bartlett's lectures, at least.
Really nice one on one, but just brutal in the classroom. He's helpful, and needs to loosen up.

He has not yet been introduced to the concept of voice inflection.  He reads his lectures word for word from essays.  He's classist and egotistical.  He refers to Stalin as Uncle Joe and Hitler as our buddy.  Not too groovy, Mark.
No Comments

Mr. Loudon misprounced the name of the French philosopher, Camus.  As Kamuss.  How do you get through years of schooling and not know how to pronounce that name?  He also called 1984 by Orwell, 1994 -- and repeated it several times.
the only positive comment is what he wrote. guaranteed. fact he uses the words groovy and dude. no other student is still living in teh eighties.  i totally agree with other dissident opinions.
Not a good complement to Bartlett
Doesn't finish thoughts-- impossible to take notes & boring.  Bartlett come back
